intro: Dipteracanthus paniculatus, commonly known as the panicled dipteracanthus, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its clustered inflorescences, which consist of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite and often have a slightly hairy texture. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
